01-01.celebration: Solemnity of Mary, the Holy Mother of God

quotes.text: Mary is more blessed in receiving the faith of Christ than in conceiving the flesh of Christ.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: Never be afraid of loving the Blessed Virgin too much; you can never love her more than Jesus did.
quotes.author: St. Maximilian Kolbe

01-02.celebration: Sts. Basil the Great and Gregory Nazianzen

quotes.text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds.
quotes.author: St. Basil the Great

quotes.text: Let us not esteem worldly prosperity or adversity as things real or of any moment, but let us live elsewhere, and raise all our attention to Heaven.
quotes.author: St. Gregory Nazianzen

01-03.celebration: The Most Holy Name of Jesus

quotes.text: The name of Jesus is the light that feeds, the light that radiates, and the light that shines.
quotes.author: St. Bernardine of Siena

quotes.text: The name of Jesus, uttered with confidence, puts the devil to flight.
quotes.author: St. John Vianney

quotes.text: Truth, by which the world is held together, has sprung from the earth in order to dwell among men.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: Christ was not found by the scribes who stayed at home, but by the Magi who took pains and went on a long journey.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: I saw the snares that the enemy spreads out over the world and I said, groaning, 'What can get through from such snares?' Then I heard a voice saying to me, 'Humility.'
quotes.author: St. Anthony the Great

quotes.text: The devil is afraid of us when we pray and make sacrifices; he is also afraid when we are humble and good.
quotes.author: St. Anthony the Great

quotes.text: God's Church stands steadfast, founded upon the blood of martyrs.
quotes.author: St. Fabian

quotes.text: We must cling to the faith of the apostles, for in it is our strength and salvation.
quotes.author: St. Fabian

quotes.text: Christ made my soul beautiful with the jewels of grace and virtue. I belong to Him whom the angels serve.
quotes.author: St. Agnes

quotes.text: It is to Him alone that I am betrothed. With Him I am promised, with Him I shall remain.
quotes.author: St. Agnes

quotes.text: Have patience with all things, but first of all with yourself.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Nothing is so strong as gentleness, nothing so gentle as real strength.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: I live, now not I, but Christ lives in me.
quotes.author: St. Paul

quotes.text: The Apostle Paul is a vessel of election, chosen to carry the name of Christ before kings and nations.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: Fight the good fight of the faith; take hold of the eternal life to which you were called.
quotes.author: St. Paul to St. Timothy

quotes.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men.
quotes.author: St. Paul to St. Titus

quotes.text: The things that we love tell us what we are.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Run, jump, shout, but do not sin.
quotes.author: St. John Bosco

quotes.text: Do good while you still have time.
quotes.author: St. John Bosco

quotes.text: My eyes have seen your salvation, which you prepared in the sight of all peoples.
quotes.author: St. Simeon (Luke 2:30-31)

quotes.text: The old man received the Child, but the Child governed the old man.
quotes.author: St. Augustine, on the Presentation

quotes.text: Be faithful even unto death, for the crown of life awaits the faithful.
quotes.author: St. Agatha

quotes.text: I offer my suffering to God, who strengthens the humble and the pure of heart.

quotes.text: I am a Christian, and I cannot deny Christ.

quotes.text: We rejoice to suffer for the name of Jesus, for eternal life is ours.
quotes.author: St. Paul Miki and Companions

quotes.text: Prayer is the food of the soul; never let it be lacking.
quotes.author: St. Scholastica

quotes.text: God's mercy is abundant; trust in Him at all times.
quotes.author: St. Scholastica

quotes.text: Glorify God with your mind and your work, so that all may know Him.
quotes.author: St. Cyril

quotes.text: Go forth and teach the nations in faith and love, bringing the light of Christ to all peoples.
quotes.author: St. Methodius

quotes.text: You are Peter, and on this rock I will build my Church.
quotes.author: Jesus Christ (Matthew 16:18)

quotes.text: The blessed Peter, chosen by the Lord, was made the foundation of the Church, that we might be built up in the faith.
quotes.author: Pope Leo the Great

quotes.text: Stand fast, therefore, in the faith, and love one another, as you have always done.
quotes.author: St. Polycarp

quotes.text: Eighty and six years have I served Christ, and He has done me no wrong.
quotes.author: St. Polycarp, on his martyrdom

quotes.text: I am not afraid of what you fear; I am a Christian.
quotes.author: St. Perpetua

quotes.text: We rejoice to suffer for Christ, for eternal life is ours.
quotes.author: St. Felicity

quotes.text: Christ with me, Christ before me, Christ behind me, Christ in me.
quotes.author: St. Patrick

quotes.text: The love of God and His grace can transform hearts and nations.
quotes.author: St. Patrick

quotes.text: Do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.

quotes.text: Let anyone who desires to honor St. Joseph know that he was chosen by God to be the guardian of the Virgin Mother and of Jesus Christ.

quotes.text: Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with you.
quotes.author: Angel Gabriel (Luke 1:28)

quotes.text: O Mary, by your fiat, heaven was opened and salvation entered the world.
quotes.author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux

quotes.text: Let us remember that we are in the holy presence of God.

quotes.text: In all your works, teach the young not only with words but with example and love.

quotes.text: It is better to die for the faith than to deny the truth of Christ.

quotes.text: A shepherd must defend his flock, even unto death.
quotes.author: St. Stanislaus

quotes.text: The Lord is my helper; I will not fear what man shall do to me.

quotes.text: Truth demands that we stand firm, even when the cost is great.

quotes.text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

quotes.text: All the way to heaven is heaven, for He said, 'I am the Way.'

quotes.text: Even if Catholics faithful to tradition are reduced to a handful, they are the ones who are the true Church.

quotes.text: The prayer of a righteous man has great power.

quotes.text: Pray, pray very much, and make sacrifices for sinners.

quotes.text: In the end, my Immaculate Heart will triumph.

quotes.text: You did not choose me, but I chose you to go and bear fruit.

quotes.text: St. Matthias was chosen to fill the place of Judas, showing God's power to restore what was broken.
quotes.author: Church tradition

quotes.text: A joyful heart is more easily made perfect than a downcast one.

quotes.text: Cheerfulness strengthens the heart and makes us persevere in a good life.

quotes.text: I am a Christian, and I will not deny this name that is so dear to me.

quotes.text: We worship the God of the Christians, whom we believe made the whole world.

quotes.text: I am ready to die for the true faith.

quotes.text: These young martyrs showed the world that Christ is worth dying for.

quotes.text: The Church is a ship that must sail through storms, yet Christ is always at the helm.
quotes.author: St. Boniface

quotes.text: Let us be soldiers of Christ, strong in faith and ready to defend the truth.
quotes.author: St. Boniface

quotes.text: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
quotes.author: Jesus (Matthew 11:28)

quotes.text: The Heart of Jesus is an inexhaustible fountain of love and mercy for all humanity.
quotes.author: St. Margaret Mary Alacoque

quotes.text: Mary kept all these things, pondering them in her heart.

quotes.text: The Immaculate Heart of Mary is a refuge for sinners and a path to Jesus.

quotes.text: He was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith.
quotes.author: Acts 11:24

quotes.text: St. Barnabas was known for his encouragement and his generous heart.

quotes.text: Actions speak louder than words; let your words teach and your actions speak.

quotes.text: The saints are like the stars; they shine in the darkness and show us the way.

quotes.text: It is better to be the child of God than king of the whole world.

quotes.text: I was born for this: to love and serve my Lord.

quotes.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.

quotes.text: You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.

quotes.text: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.

quotes.text: I forgive him, and I want him to be with me in heaven.

quotes.text: Go forth and set the world on fire.

quotes.text: Teach us to give and not to count the cost.

quotes.text: The priesthood is the love of the heart of Jesus.

quotes.text: A good confession is the beginning of a good life.

quotes.text: This is my beloved Son; listen to Him.

quotes.text: Preach the truth with words and deeds.

quotes.text: Arm yourself with prayer rather than with a sword; wear humility rather than fine clothes.

quotes.text: The treasures of the Church are the poor and the needy.

quotes.text: We become what we love, and who we love shapes what we become.

quotes.text: Gaze upon Christ, consider Christ, contemplate Christ, as you desire to imitate Christ.

quotes.text: A single act of love makes the soul return to life.

quotes.text: I want to be consumed for the Immaculate Virgin.

quotes.text: You are all beautiful, my love; there is no flaw in you.

quotes.text: Holy Communion is the shortest and safest way to heaven.

quotes.text: A sword will pierce through your own soul also.

quotes.text: Pray, hope, and don't worry.

quotes.text: The angels are messengers of God's love and protectors of His people.

quotes.text: Ignorance of Scripture is ignorance of Christ.

quotes.text: The best way to learn is to teach; the best way to understand is to explain.

quotes.text: I will spend my heaven doing good on earth.

quotes.text: Preach the Gospel at all times; when necessary, use words.

quotes.text: Do not be afraid. Open wide the doors to Christ.

quotes.text: Souls are won on our knees.

quotes.text: Lord, do not hold this sin against them.
quotes.author: St. Stephen (Acts 7:60)

quotes.text: I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.
quotes.author: St. Stephen (Acts 7:56)

quotes.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
quotes.author: St. John (John 1:1)

quotes.text: Little children, love one another.
quotes.author: St. John's constant exhortation

quotes.text: A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and loud lamentation.
quotes.author: Matthew 2:18

quotes.text: These innocent children bore witness to Christ without words, but with their very lives.
quotes.author: Church tradition

quotes.text: Remember that you are dust, and to dust you shall return. Repent and believe in the Gospel.
quotes.author: Ash Wednesday Liturgy

quotes.text: The season of Lent is a gift to prepare our hearts, that we may turn from sin and be faithful to the Gospel.
quotes.author: Church tradition

palmSunday.celebration: Palm Sunday of the Lord's Passion

quotes.text: Hosanna! Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord
quotes.author: Matthew 21:9

quotes.text: He humbled Himself, becoming obedient unto death, even death on a cross.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

holyThursday.celebration: Holy Thursday (Mass of the Lord's Supper)

quotes.text: This is My body.
quotes.author: Jesus Christ (Matthew 26:26)

quotes.text: The Eucharist is the source and summit of the Christian life. In the blessed Eucharist is contained the whole spiritual good of the Church.
quotes.author: Second Vatican Council

quotes.text: Father, into your hands I commend my spirit.
quotes.author: Jesus Christ (Luke 23:46)

quotes.text: On the cross, the Son of God showed the depth of His love; let us unite our sufferings to His.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: He is not here, for He has risen, as He said.
quotes.author: Angel at the tomb (Matthew 28:6)

quotes.text: Rejoice, for through Christ's resurrection, death has been conquered and hope restored.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: He is risen! Alleluia!
quotes.author: Traditional proclamation (based on Matthew 28:6)

quotes.text: The resurrection of Christ is the victory of love over death; let us live in this hope.
quotes.author: St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Mankind will not have peace until it turns with trust to My mercy.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: My Heart overflows with great mercy for souls, and especially for poor sinners.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: I am going to prepare a place for you, and I will come again.
quotes.author: Jesus Christ (John 14:2-3)

quotes.text: Christ ascended to heaven to give us confidence that where the Head has gone, the body will follow.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: Come, Holy Spirit, fill the hearts of your faithful and kindle in them the fire of your love.
quotes.author: Traditional prayer

quotes.text: The Holy Spirit transforms the apostles from fearful men into bold witnesses of Christ.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.text: O sacred banquet, in which Christ is received, the memory of His Passion is renewed, the mind is filled with grace, and a pledge of future glory is given to us.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: The Eucharist is the Heart of the Church; where Eucharistic life flourishes, there the life of the Church will blossom.
quotes.author: Pope John Paul II
